item.title: Amazon Prime Gaming Free Games for Prime Day Revealed
item.description:
Highlights

  • New free games available on Prime Gaming starting June 24 in celebration of Prime Day 2024.
  • 15 games will be released leading up to Prime Day 2024, available for Prime subscribers.
  • Prime Gaming perks include a free Twitch channel subscription, a selection of titles to play via Luna cloud gaming, and in-game items.

Amazon has revealed the next batch of games it will be adding to Prime Gaming , which will be available to claim beginning on June 24 through July 16. Prime Gaming is one of the many perks that come with having an Amazon Prime subscription, along with free one and two-day shipping, streaming movies and TV shows, ebooks, and music.

Amazon Prime Gaming adds at least one new free title each week, whether it be an indie gem or a AAA classic, and these can be accessed through the Amazon Gaming App, GOG, Epic Games Store, and other online retailers. Unlike the Xbox Game Pass and PS Plus gaming subscription services, Prime Gaming titles are permanently added to a person’s library and remain accessible even if they stop subscribing to Amazon Prime.

Prime Day 2024, Amazon’s biggest sale of the year, is scheduled to take place from July 16 – 17, and leading up to the event, Prime Gaming will be making 15 games available to Prime subscribers at no extra cost. These games won’t be released all at once, so members will need to check back in the coming days to grab them all.

Amazon Prime Gaming Free Games, June 24 – July 16

Game

Availability Date

Platform

Deceive Inc

June 24

Epic Games Store

Tearstone: Thieves of the Heart

Legacy Games

The Invisible Hand

Amazon Games App

Call of Juarez

GOG

Forager

June 27

GOG

Card Shark

Epic Games Store

Heaven Dust 2

Amazon Games App

Soulstice

Epic Games Store

Wall World

July 3

Amazon Games App

Hitman Absolution

GOG

Call of Juarez: Bound in Blood

GOG

Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Shredder’s Revenge

July 11

Epic Games Store

Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic 2 - The Sith Lords

Amazon Games App

Alex Kidd in Miracle World DX

Epic Games Store

Samurai Bringer

Amazon Games App

While most of these titles will be familiar to gamers, some might have fallen under the radar. Deceive Inc. is a multiplayer game that launched in March 2023 and currently has a Very Positive rating on Steam. Players are members of an elite espionage organization that must use gadgets and cunning to grab the bag before a rival team does. On the other end of the spectrum, Soulstice is a moody dark fantasy adventure game in which two sisters with special powers must save their world from the feral Wraith. And for those looking for a fun sim to pass the time, The Invisible Hand puts players in the role of a mid-level stockbroker whose primary focus is moving up in the world of finance.

Prime Gaming members can also still claim the free games for June, which will be available through the end of the month. These include Star Wars: Battlefront 2 (2005 version), Weird West Definitive Edition, Genesis Noir, Everdream Valley, MythForce, Blast Brigade vs. the Evil Legion of Dr. Cread , and Projection: First Light .

There are other perks to being an Amazon Prime subscriber as well. Every month, Prime Gaming gives members one free Twitch channel subscription that they can gift to a streamer of their choice. A range of games are also free to play on Luna, Amazon’s cloud gaming service, and these are swapped out fairly regularly. Currently, members can enjoy Fallout 3, Fallout: New Vegas, Metro Exodus, Overcooked, and Fortnite, to name a few. There are also free in-game items available to claim, ranging from weapon skins to in-game currency and special outfits for a variety of titles.

item.title: Shadow Of The Erdtree: O Mother Gesture Location - Elden Ring DLC
item.description:
Quick Links

  • O Mother Gesture Location In Elden Ring Shadow Of The Erdtree
  • How To Reach Scadu Altus In Elden Ring Shadow Of The Erdtree

Gestures are physical movements that Tarnished will perform in Elden Ring . It’s usually a way to communicate with other players or simply for fun, like how you got the Ring of Miquella Gesture upon starting the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC.

However, some of these Gestures can actually be used in certain locations and situations to reveal secrets in Elden Ring . The O Mother Gesture in Shadow of the Erdtree Elden Ring DLC happens to be related to Count Ymir's Quest in the Realm of Shadow, which makes it automatically related to Jolan Quest as well.

O Mother Gesture Location In Elden Ring Shadow Of The Erdtree

The O Mother Gesture in Elden Ring can be found near the Bonny Village in the Scadu Altus region. To reach it, fast-travel to Moorth Ruins and head east to the entrance of an underground area. Jump down and proceed forward to the end of the area until a ladder appears. Use it to find yourself immediately in Bonny Village.

From the Bonny Village Site of Lost Grace, go northeast past the enemies to find a broken bridge. Use Torrent to jump to the other side and then continue running north past a broken shack that has a Hefty Cracked Pot to reach a tree. Loot the corpse to get the O Mother Gesture .

How To Reach Scadu Altus In Elden Ring Shadow Of The Erdtree

There are two methods to reach Scadu Altus in Elden Ring . One of them is the normal one, where you need to progress through the first area and explore thoroughly until you reach Castle Ensis and defeat Rellana, Twin Moon Knight. Once the battle is over, head outside to find yourself in Scadu Altus. After that, go east to find the Ruins.

Alternatively, players can go there without beating Rellana in Castle Ensis. First, head southeast from the Castle Front Site of Lost Grace until you find a slope that leads down. Next, head north then east through the swamps filled with Miranda Sprouts. Along the way, there will be a Sealed Spiritspring that you can unseal by hitting the rocks on the upper hill.

Once the Spiritspring is working again, use it while riding Torrent to go higher and then use another found a few steps ahead to land inside the Fort of Reprimand, which makes you inside Scadu Altus. Jump down from the building and head north past the Dragonflame Dragon boss to find the Moorth Ruins and then proceed normally to find the O Mother Gesture.

item.title: Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom Should Revist One Controversial Dungeon Design
item.description:
Highlights

  • Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom shifts the focus to Princess Zelda, bringing a fresh perspective to the classic series in a top-down adventure.
  • The game borrows elements from past Zelda titles, promising innovative gameplay mechanics and a new take on the franchise.
  • By implementing a unique dungeon design similar to Phantom Hourglass, Echoes of Wisdom could create a fresh and engaging experience for fans.

The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom seems to be upholding the tradition of innovation for a series that has been going strong for well over three decades. Announced at the recent Nintendo Direct, the game will see Princess Zelda take center stage in a title that bears resemblance to previous Nintendo Switch titles and has all the potential to shake up the aging franchise once again.

Not much is known about Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom past the trailer and its September 26 release date, which means that fans will likely be surprised by its twists and turns, and just how it will adhere to the franchise's lofty reputation. One way it could achieve this is by taking cues from one aspect of a largely underappreciated Zelda gem.

The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom Looks to be Doing Something Different

Although there is more that needs revealing about the recently announced title, what players do know is that they will be taking control of Princess Zelda for the first time in the mainline series, and using the Tri Rod to conjure creative ways to get around and solve puzzles. It's a game that borrows the art style of 2019's remake of Game Boy classic Link's Awakening , and draws some similarities with Tears of the Kingdom by allowing players more freedom over how they tackle the game's systems. Being a project that is taking cues from the past, it's not a stretch to think that it could do the same for the less well-loved handheld entries.

Implementing a dungeon design similar to the Temple of the Ocean King from Phantom Hourglass would make Zelda's journey in Echoes of Wisdom feel fundamentally different from the traditional format of Link's adventures, which could in turn kick-start something new moving forward. Having two protagonists in The Legend of Zelda means that there is more room for different ideas, environments, and core mechanics, and the format of Phantom Hourglass' biggest dungeon could be the catalyst for something unique, further justifying Zelda's place as the protagonist instead of having her at the forefront simply because it's a novel idea.

Zelda: Phantom Hourglass' Unique Dungeon Concept is Worth Revisiting

Phantom Hourglass ' Temple of the Ocean King being a place that Link revisits periodically made it different from every other dungeon in the series to date. Instead of having players enter an area, solve the puzzles, and never return, Phantom Hourglass made it so that the Temple of the Ocean King was designed to be chipped away at, with at least five visits during a single playthrough as Link searches for Sea Charts. To some, it made the progression in Phantom Hourglass feel stale and unrewarding, but since the idea hasn't been returned to, its potential positives seem to have been completely forgotten by fans and Nintendo alike.

The Legend of Zelda: Phantom Hourglass is a direct sequel to 2003's Wind Waker.

Having one central dungeon which is to be explored and re-explored not only helps shorten development time as there are fewer environments to create, but it also gives a sense of improvement across a game's story. Ticking separate dungeons off the list is great, but it often feels like there's another just around the corner, and it's easier to notice the progression when it's all happening in one place. Phantom Hourglass understood this but perhaps didn't implement it well enough. Since the release of Phantom Hourglass on the DS, the genre has evolved and the rise of rogue-likes could warrant revisiting this dungeon concept with a modern twist.

item.title: Final Fantasy 14: How To Unlock Every Ultimate Raid
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Unlock The Unending Coil Of Bahamut And The Weapon's Refrain
  • How To Unlock The Epic Of Alexander
  • How To Unlock Dragonsong's Reprise And The Omega Protocol

Final Fantasy 14 is well-known for its punishingly difficult raid encounters, featuring both a normal difficulty for players looking to enjoy the story, as well as a Savage difficulty for players wanting to test their skills against revamped bosses with new mechanics for a chance at best-in-slot gear. In recent expansions, however, Final Fantasy 14 has introduced an even higher difficulty of raids called Ultimate raids, revisiting old bosses and introducing new, devastatingly punishing attack patterns in excruciating boss rush-style encounters, often lasting over 15 minutes in length. At the time of writing, there are five Ultimate raids in the game, with a sixth raid, Future's Rewritten (Ultimate), announced for release in patch 7.11.

While Ultimate raids are among the most difficult content players can tackle in Final Fantasy 14 , players that are able to complete them will be rewarded with an exclusive achievement, title, and customizations for their character portraits and adventurer plates. Most importantly, these raids will also drop a totem that can be exchanged for unique weapons with impressive visual effects themed after the encounter, allowing players to show off their accomplishment in style.

How To Unlock The Unending Coil Of Bahamut And The Weapon's Refrain

The first Ultimate raids introduced in the Stormblood expansion, The Unending Coil of Bahamut (UCoB) and The Weapon's Refrain (UWU), appear at level 70 and can be unlocked by completing boss encounters in the Omega series of raids on Savage difficulty. To unlock the prerequisite Omega raids, players will need to have completed the level 70 Main Scenario Quest " Stormblood ," followed by the side quest " The Hunt for Omega " in Rhaglr's Reach (X:12.5, Y:12.4).

Players will need to complete the normal difficulty version of each wing of the raid, consisting of four bosses each and a small quest chain, in order to unlock their Savage difficult counterparts from the Magitek Terminal in Rhalgr's Reach (X:13.5, Y:12.4) . The first wing, Deltascape V4.0 (Savage), is required to unlock The Unending Coil of Bahamut, while the second wing, Sigmascape V4.0 (Savage), is required to unlock The Weapon's Refrain. Once the prerequisite fights have been completed, the Ultimate raids can be unlocked by speaking to the Wandering Minstrel in Kugane (X:11.6, Y:12.6) .

How To Unlock The Epic Of Alexander

The only Ultimate raid added during the Shadowbringers expansion, The Epic of Alexander (TEA), occurs at level 80, requiring completion of Eden's Gate: Sepulture (Savage) , the first wing of the Eden series of raids. This wing can be unlocked by completing the level 80 Main Scenario Quest "Shadowbringers," followed by the quest chain beginning with " In the Middle of Nowhere " in The Crystarium (X:9.7, Y:12.3).

Once the normal difficulty raid has been completed, the Savage difficulty can be unlocked for this wing by speaking to Lewrey in Ahm Araeng (X:26.9, Y:16.3) . Once players defeat Eden's Gate: Sepulture (Savage), The Epic of Alexander can be unlocked by speaking to the Wandering Minstrel in Kugane (X:11.6, Y:12.6) .

How To Unlock Dragonsong's Reprise And The Omega Protocol

The final Ultimate raids at the time of writing, added during the Endwalker expansion, occur at level 90. Both Dragonsong's Reprise (DSR) and The Omega Protocol (TOP) require the completion of Savage difficulty Pandaemonium raids, with Dragonsong's Reprise requiring the completion of Asphodelos: The Fourth Circle (Savage) , and The Omega Protocol requiring completion of Abyssos: The Eighth Circle (Savage) .

These Pandaemonium raids can be unlocked by first completing the level 90 Main Scenario Quest "Endwalker," followed by the quest chain beginning with " The Crystal from Beyond " in Old Sharlayan (X:9.7, Y:12.3). Like the raids before it, unlocking the Savage difficulty for the Pandaemonium raids requires players to first complete the normal difficulty, then speak to Nemjiji in Labyrinthos (X:8.4, Y:27.4) . Once the prerequisite Savage fights have been completed, the Ultimate raids can finally be unlocked by speaking to the Wandering Minstrel in Old Sharlayan (X:12.7, Y:14.2) .

item.title: Genshin Impact: Best Weapons For Sigewinne
item.description:
Sigewinne

Hydro

Bow

Fontaine

Guides

Ascension

Builds

Weapons

Team Comp

Constellation

Player Mistakes

Back to All Characters

Sigewinne is the second healer in Genshin Impact that uses a Bow, following Diona who was released early in version 1.1. Like the bartender, Sigewinne also scales with HP, although she bears the Hydro Vision instead of Cryo. Additionally, being a Fontaine character, Sigewinne comes with Bond of Life and Ousia mechanics.

The Fortress of Meropide head nurse heals with her Skill, while her Burst is a damage-dealing ability that can dish decent damage in exchange for several seconds of field time. While using Sigewinne as a main DPS is definitely not ideal, players can still make use of her personal DPS on top of maximizing her healing. This can be done by using the correct Sigewinne weapons in Genshin Impact .

7 Fading Twilight

  • Main Stat : 565 Base ATK
  • Sub-Stat : 30.6% Energy Recharge
  • R5 Effect : Has three states, Evengleam, Afterglow, and Dawnblaze, which increase DMG dealt by 12%/20%/28% respectively. When attacks hit opponents, this weapon will switch to the next state. This weapon can change states once every 7s. The character equipping this weapon can still trigger the state switch while not on the field.

Fading Twilight is an event-exclusive weapon in Genshin Impact , so it’s not accessible to everyone. Those who have it, however, can definitely use it on Sigewinne, especially as a budget sub-DPS option.

6 Sacrificial Bow

  • Main Stat : 565 Base ATK
  • Sub-Stat : 30.6% Energy Recharge
  • R5 Effect : After dealing damage to an opponent with an Elemental Skill, the skill has a 80% chance to end its own CD. Can only occur once every 16s.

Sacrificial Bow can help Sigewinne heal as much as possible with the CD reset. Just remember that only one Bolstering Bubblebalm can exist at once, so players shouldn’t use her Skill consecutively.

5 Aqua Simulacra

  • Main Stat : 542 Base ATK
  • Sub-Stat : 88.2% Crit DMG
  • R1 Effect : HP is increased by 16%. When there are opponents nearby, the DMG dealt by the wielder of this weapon is increased by 20%. This will take effect whether the character is on-field or not.

Aqua Simulacra is generally an amazing Bow in Genshin Impact , but for Sigewinne, it’s great as she can actually utilize the HP boost. This weapon is best for a sub-DPS Sigewinne since it heavily focuses on damage dealing.

4 Favonius Warbow

  • Main Stat : 454 Base ATK
  • Sub-Stat : 61.3% Energy Recharge
  • R5 Effect : CRIT hits have a 100% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 6s.

Favonius weapons in Genshin Impact are one of the best equipment for characters to support the team’s Energy recovery. With Favonius Warbow, Sigewinne can regain her Burst faster while also helping the team’s Energy.

3 Elegy For The End

  • Main Stat : 608 Base ATK
  • Sub-Stat : 55.1% Energy Recharge
  • R1 Effect : Increases Elemental Mastery by 60. When the Elemental Skills or Elemental Bursts of the character wielding this weapon hit opponents, that character gains a Sigil of Remembrance. This effect can be triggered once every 0.2s and can be triggered even if said character is not on the field. When you possess 4 Sigils of Remembrance, all of them will be consumed and all nearby party members will obtain the "Millennial Movement: Farewell Song" effect for 12s. "Millennial Movement: Farewell Song" increases Elemental Mastery by 100 and increases ATK by 20%. Once this effect is triggered, you will not gain Sigils of Remembrance for 20s. Of the many effects of the "Millennial Movement," buffs of the same type will not stack.

Elegy for the End is not a common household name, but it’s a decent weapon for Sigewinne in Genshin Impact . Unlike Recurve Bow, which maximizes her healing, Elegy for the End is more suitable when players don’t need an overflow of HP recovery . This weapon grants Energy Recharge, allowing Sigewinne to Ult more, and its passive can boost the team’s Elemental Mastery and ATK.

2 Recurve Bow

  • Main Stat : 354 Base ATK
  • Sub-Stat : 46.9% HP
  • R5 Effect : Defeating an opponent restores 16% HP.

Recurve Bow is easily the best F2P weapon for Sigewinne in Genshin Impact . It gives a large amount of HP from its sub-stat, and the passive can further heal her when she defeats an enemy. This is ideal if players want as much healing as possible to maximize Furina’s Fanfare .

1 Silvershower Heartstrings

  • Main Stat : 542 Base ATK
  • Sub-Stat : 66.2% HP
  • R1 Effect : The equipping character can gain the Remedy effect. When they possess 1/2/3 Remedy stacks, Max HP will increase by 12%/24%/40%. 1 stack may be gained when the following conditions are met: 1 stack for 25s when using an Elemental Skill; 1 stack for 25s when the value of a Bond of Life value increases; 1 stack for 20s for performing healing. Stacks can still be triggered when the equipping character is not on the field. Each stack's duration is counted independently. In addition, when 3 stacks are active, Elemental Burst CRIT Rate will be increased by 28%. This effect will be canceled 4s after falling under 3 stacks.

Silvershower Heartstrings comes with low base ATK, which doesn’t matter for Sigewinne since she wants all the health points she can get. This Genshin Impact Bow further increases her HP via its passive, and once she maximizes the weapon’s stack, her Elemental Burst will get a large Crit Rate boost, allowing players to focus more on Crit DMG from her artifact sub-stats.
